Hello, I'm Duoming!

I am ...
A front-end developer.
A person who likes to bring new ideas into reality.

Find me at...
bianduom@umich.edu
Learn more about my...
Download My Resume

Experience

Learn about My internship with Productiv and more

Internship with Productiv

I interned with Productiv during summer 2019. Productiv is a SaaS app analyzing company, with a focus on providing insights on employees' usage events for IT managers. At Productiv, the tech stack primarily contains Node.js, Vue.js and AWS. As a team, Productiv collects employee usage information via deploying collectors and aggregators through AWS, and storage such data to DynamoDB, then display insights and recommendations for rightsizing on our product.

As an intern, I had the opportunity to design and implement several different projects, both on the front end as well as the back end.

On the back end, I designed and implemented an AWS lambda function that provides username recommendations during searching. It achieves this functionality by first collecting usernames from Productiv's DynamoDB database, then aggregate the usernames into search-tries that provide fast response when requested. This service is deployed as a lambda function and re-collects the data once a day.

On the front end, I designed and developed several new UIs and functionalities, such as a dropdown that allows users to segment the data displayed by locations and teams, and an entirely new page that displays analyzing data for Zoom meetings usage. This is done with Vue.js and Vuex.

Education

Check out my persue of Computer Science at University of Michigan

Bachelor of Science in Engineering

Currently I'm persuing a degree in Computer Science at the University of Michigan. My interest is primarily in front end developing, although I am also interested in computer security and operating system.

Growing up, computers have been an important part of my childhood. With my father being a software engineer himself, I was greatly influenced by him and developed an interest in computers. Watching my father coding day after day, it was an easy decision for me to pick Computer Science as my major when I was offered a position in the University of Michigan.

Projects

Ever wonder if there is a best strategy for Poker?

Evolution of Poker Strategy

Poker is a complicated game. Some suggest there are superior strategies one can take, other suggest that it is pure gamble. Out of curiosity, along with two other friends, we are currently developing a website that gives you the options to create your own poker strategy and have it compete with other default strategies through a series of Poker games. The games will be simulated visually and winning strategies will replace losing strategies, similar to how evolution works. If your strategy ends up being the most populated one, it is a good indicator for a winning strategy.

We are currently working on this project. It is made with React.js and Node.js.

Prisoner's Dilemma Simulator

I also worked on a project that lets two strangers play a game based off the famous Prisoner's Dilemma. The game is slightly modified so that the two players have to go through a series of games, where they have to choose to either cooperate or betray. We analyzed the data of how people make their decisions and found out that the most successful players tend to deploy a "tit for tac" strategy, meaning they alway cooperate when their opponent also cooperates, and vice versa.
